intro: Hieracium meridionale, commonly known as the southern hawkweed, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to southern Europe and parts of North Africa. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, characterized by its composite flower heads that resemble a single flower. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, with hairy stems and basal leaves that are lance-shaped and often covered in fine hairs. Its flowers are yellow, arranged in a flat-topped cluster, and bloom from late spring to early autumn. Hieracium meridionale is often found in meadows, grasslands, and disturbed soils, and it is known for its ability to thrive in a variety of environmental conditions.
